column1: Yeah about 10 years ago I had a horrifying experience. It was 100% their fault but they hit the water barrels and survived. They had no injuries but they almost ran me off the road.	That is terrifying! I know for sure that you will be fine and that they almost lost a loved one. They are such bad people!
No I wasn't hit. It turned out they were drunk. I felt guilty but realized it was his fault.	Well that's all we really know about him.

I don't know I was new to driving and hadn't experienced anything like that. I felt like my horn made him swerve into the water barrels.	Well, can you tell me about your experience? I think we swapped places	Well, I went to Venice with you!
Oh my goodness, that's very scary! I hope you are okay now and the drunk driver was punished for his actions?	Yes, his license was revoked.
I there, dont know what to do, jst broke up with my girlfirned, we were 8 years together	I'm sorry to hear that, it must be hard.
Yes we decided together with our minds, and know i come home and feel so distant from the world	Yes I think that's a good thing, you can learn to embrace the distance, you can love the unknown!
I couldn't wait to go to the concert.	What concert was it?

The U2 concert. Tickets were really expensive and I never thought we would be able to go, but somehow we did!!!	That's awesome. Are you going because you want to go to see them or because you just really like U2?
I'm so sad because i've read an article about a newborn girl who died because her parents didn't believe in medication and doctors	That is so terrible. I am so sorry for your loss.
she was born premature at home, she had hard time breathing on her own but instead of taking her to the doctor parents were just praying	That is terrible but they will be okay no?

yes! And i do believe in God and prayers but goodness gracious please take your children to the hospital and let God heal them THROUGH doctors	so my friend's baby fell down and scraped his knee yesterday and i was trying so hard to cheer him up	Oh no! I hope he's okay now.
i was singing nursery songs :)	Ooh, that's nice of you! How old are you?
If you happy and you know it :)	my husband lost a job but i'm hoping he can find a full time job soon	That's good that you are hopeful. What's wrong with the economy right now?
thank you so much!	No problem, I'll talk to you tomorrow about spring cleaning at work.
he is an armed guard	i just moved to this neighborhood and some dumb criminals shot one of my neighbors and ran into the woods!	Geeze, did the nanny died?
I do! I want to be able to protect my son	I protective of my kids too. Always watch out!
i'm so excited because i'm finally going to visit my parents next month! I didn't see them for 3 years	That's great. Where did you guys move to?
I moved to the US and they stayed in my homecountry	I have been there. Ik basically lived in your house for a whole year. How come you were not affected?
I was very angry when a co worker lied about a car accident to get out of working July 4th. I covered his shift till midnight and he was lying about the accident	Oh no! Did he get fired?

Yeah he got caught in someones pics on Facebook. Never lie and then go out with people who like to take pictures.	Yeah but what a random occurrence. There have been plenty of times I've cheated by taking cool pics of weddings.

Good idea. i don't like social media that much. It can get you in to trouble fast, even when expressing your opinions.	So yeah i drove 2 hours to get to wallmart. with 299 in my wallet as advertised, and the real price of the tv was 399 usd. what a bummer	Oh wow that's a really steep discount if you ask us. Maybe you can find a local Apple store and get one for 399 usd.
Yeah i had my hopes reall high and then i left empty handed, such a terrible feeling!	Empty bowls are usually a terrible feeling. I hope you find enjoyment in your new bowl of noodles.

Yes, i guess walmart and the rest of false advertisement in the US, the look in my daugther eyes when i came home empty handed	My friend's boyfriend recently made a pass at me. I'm married, and I also am really good friend's with his girlfriend so I felt really bad. I made sure he knew I was loyal and honest to both!	I am sorry, you sure are loved and needed

I struggled with it, but my friend was in a really bad spot, with no income and raising her grandchild, he was the financial supporter. So, I didn't tell her, as I knew it would really hurt her in several ways, plus she really loves him!	Well I hope it wasnt too hard for both of you! I'm sure she'll be happy to know that you are there for her.
my baby is sleeping. it's so peaceful and quiet in this house	That is awesome, do you love that baby?
i totally agree with you!	Good! I wish I could agree with you more. I have tried, and it's not fun.
hi, i feel so lonely sometimes because all my friends live in a different country	I feel the same way in general
i was thinking about it! I wanted to join a group for local moms	i heard a while ago that changing diapers for a living is crazy hard work, and takes a lot of dedication

I have a friend that has a child that is unruly and does bad things. One day at our home, he grabbed a game and sat on it, instantly breaking it! It was expensive and this really irked me, especially because she doesn't discipline him when he does bad things.	Athletes always seem to have their own set of rules. Glad you're not his parent.

Me either! I have two of my own children, and I would have never let them get away with that kind of behavior when they were his age. I just don't understand those kind of parents@!	Some people need to "grow up" I would say! I really don't like the idea of children who watch TV all day or play games all day. They need to "grow up". They have so much development to do on their own when they are young. I'm glad they are learning and feeling responsible for themselves but I wish they would let their kids do what they want whenever they want
I'm so scared of bugs! i found one in my hair yesterday and almost died	thats terrible

Ugh I hate bugs with a passion, they are so creepy	I recently spoke with my ex-girlfriend on the phone. The conversation went pretty well, and it reminded me of my past experiences with her.	The phone conversations can be a timesaving appendage when you don't have a written record. It's well worth retaining the conversations, for they can provide closure and context for your relationship.

Yes, they ended somewhat well, but there were tense moments. I am glad she's doing well, but I miss her.	I know that feeling well, my sibling is my best friend and I miss him like crazy. Is she able to come over more often?
Thank you! That means a lot.	One of the times I remember feeling the most blissed out in life was right after the birth of my first child.	That's a real testament to your fertility.

Obviously there are the demands of a new child -- but that feeling of finally meeting someone you waited so long for, and the love surrounding the whole situation. Truly something to remember.	Yes, love is love. There's no better feeling than that.

Have you ever been in a situation when payment of some kind has come through *just* in the nick of time?! Talk about gratitude!	Oh yeah just everywhere you needed it. The ATMs I worked at had WAY too many machines. It was crazy!

Absolutely. You go from scared and desperate to grateful and optimistic in one quick moment! It's not a situation I wish to be in again.	You went from being scared and depressed to being positive in one day. I'm glad you're doing great now.
Im so grateful for my family due to an incident with my friend	What did they do?

My friend lost her parents and siblings in a fire and their family was very close to mine. So seeing her go through the grief made me realize how thankful I should be	I'm so sorry to hear that. My parents lost mine, so did my siblings, and I lost mine, soaks it all in air every once in a while.

Yes definitely. Never take anything for granted as you never know when it will be taken away from you	I'm a big believer in listening to your gut. Sometimes I might wonder where my intuition is leading me, but it always seems to be spot on.	Well that is great. Where do you think your intuition is leading you?

It is a "knowing" -- and a flowing! When something is right, it just feels easier to go with it -- like you're being led, even if you might not fully know to where.	That is wonderful. Leadership is all about trust and having a good time. I am sure you will have blastas and have a blast!

I couldnt celebrate my 18th birthday as I had exams during the time and I felt terrible for it. But my friends threw a surprise party for me and it was the best!	ylee you must be very lucky, how old are you

I was studying in my bedroom for a couple of hours straight with headphones on and then my mom called me to the living room for dinner and when I went out the whole place was decorated and everyone was there	OMG! Was she like, "What did you study"?

I feel lonely sometimes cause I live in a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and sometimes they are all hanging out with their significant others and I feel lonely	I'm sorry that you feel that way. Maybe you should try to hang out with some of the girls and see how they feel about that.

Sometimes they joke about it and obviously I make it look like its totally fine cause I dont want to give them the impression that I am lonely but it does hurt sometimes	I'm sorry you have to go through that. Have you thought about trying to get along with people?

As silly as it sounds, I was so surprised at how different my two kids were as babies. You're reminded that they're wired with their own personalities from the git-go.	It's so great you still have those memories of that time. I wish you a lot of luck in raising them the best that you can.

One was pacifier, one was fingers. One wanted to co-sleep, one liked her space. One liked facing *out* in the Baby Bjorn carrier, one liked cocooning in a sling!	That is so cute! I had a little girl like that when I was a little. cocoon in a sling. Thats so sad.
The other day I had a deep craving for Chik-Fil-A.	Yeah, I have never had the hot dog with ketchup and mayo.
Mine too. So I drive there and pull in the parking lot and it's completely empty. I then realized it was Sunday.	I am sorry, that is awful. Did you talk to the manager?
I visited an orphan once and it was such a surreal moment. It made me realise how thankful I should be for a family	Ah, so this is where my orphan story ends.
Yes it definitely was. I went with intentions to teach the kid a few things but I ended up learning lots more from him	I am sure he will now respect you for it.

My oldest and my husband have always had a rough relationship. I've got to believe that as she gets older, it will get better!	That's good to hear. I hope it does and that you guys are able to be together.

That's always good to hear. But in the moment -- argh, my *heart*. How did your mom maneuver the differences between y'all? Did that wear on her?	Mom always has that last bit of information you need to make a decision responsibiliteseous

But in the meantime -- the unspoken strain is NOT fun. But I'm glad to hear about a happy ending -- thank you for that!	I can still look back with shame at the way I treated a girl in sixth grade. I wasn't as bad as others, but that doesn't make me feel any better.	that is true, but it is difficult to look back and be ashamed, it is very normal to feel that way

Well, like a lot of 6th graders I was aware of *not* wanting to be an outcast for any reason. And unfortunately, she was. As an adult of course, my heart squeezes for *all* the kids we were!	Ha ha! I bet it's not as bad as you imagined. We all make mistakes.

Unfortunately, she died. I only found out when Facebook first came out, and her brother and I "friended" one another.	I am so sorry to hear that, it must have been so hard. Friends aren't made in heaven or earth. I hope you find peace of mind.

I'm currently working for someone that is *such* a great example of a leader! It makes going into work inspiring every day / every way.	That's great! I like to think that my own leadership has been inspiring as well! What company do you work for?

That's a very kind statement, and certainly what I would strive for. And it's the rarity that *inspires* me. That should be the norm, not the exception! THAT'S what I'd like to inspire in people. How about you?	I would encourage you to be confident and to take things day at a time. Not to be so hard on yourself.
That is soul-sapping. What do you do to inspire yourself, and not let that kind of behavior drag you down?	I try to stay active. Also, create lasting habits that will help you in the future.
My friend's baby has grown so much since the last time I had seen her!	Wow, that is crazy, has she moved recently?
It had been about 8 weeks - I don't get out her way often, even though we live 30 minutes away.	I'm sorry it has to be that way.

Yes!  I got to be 'auntie' for a bit and help change her and get her fed and down for a nap while my friend had a chance to toss laundry in the wash.  It was a good day for everyone!	Running my first (and maybe only!) marathon felt like *such* a huge accomplishment!	oh wow, i bet it was an amazing experience, did you enjoy yourself and glad you did that good!
Ah, it was the best! Plus it helped that I purposely chose an amazing destination in which to run it -- it was the Venice Marathon!	ohh that is a nice name it makes it stand out

We were living overseas at the times -- the most impressive part was crossing the Grand Canal over a pontoon of boats to finish the marathon ;-)	How interesting! I bet that was a blast you both enjoyed!

I recently found out that a person I very much intimately admired did not feel the same way for me. I was pretty surprised.	oh, I am glad to hear that, after everything that happened, it would be really hard to romantically approach someone again?
She just started treating me differently all of a sudden. And now she is going to be moving away soon.	That's so sad. Are you going to be able to keep up with her when you have kids?

I'm always appalled when I see bullying in action -- whether it's on a playground or political stage -- not much makes me angrier.	I'm not sure I understand how that is possible. You must be very confused.

How do you channel the anger? Obviously, it too easily turns into the same kind of negative emotion I'm upset about -- so that can feel hypocritical!	Oh yes, I have to think of that--even if it's in anger, it's never a good strategy to let that fuel it. Anger is never a good way to advance the cause of any cause

Are you ever tempted to put anyone's face on the punching bag?! Ha! (Kidding/not kidding!)	One morning my mother came to my house to pick my daughter up for school and told me she saw my daughter's cat on the road and he had been hit. I had to tell my daughter about the loss of her beloved pet.	That must've been embarrasing. How did you find the cat?
She was around 11, so she took it very hard. I went ahead and let her stay home from school, as I knew she wouldn't do well that day.	I'm sure she learned quickly that her grades need to be up.
I was soooo excited to take our kids to Disneyland for the first time!	I have never been! I think it's very small and the rides are not very fun. Did you have a good time?

Same! I was excited because I grew up going there. My grandparents lived in Tucson, and we would spend the summers with them -- the most exciting part being our drive to Disneyland each year!	That's pretty neat but I know how it feels, especially if you don't visit often. I was wondering if there was anything you could do to bring something back to that special memory?

California! Old school ;-) They've kept so much of the original, while adding lots of new attractions.	I recently spoke to my father for the first time in years. It reminded me of my childhood and the distant past.	That's wonderful to hear from someone you've only had a very short time with. Did you guys communicate in a normal way or in tongues?
We spoke about our recent lives. Apparently he is in the market for a new car.	Nice. I hope you can help him find the car he wants!

Do you like to organize your house.  My mother-in-law recently surprised me recently with some organizing stuff b/c she knows how much I love it!	I do like to organize my house sometimes, it's kinda fun.

Labels and Bins can be your best friend!  Especially with a new baby.	Oh boy, I'm worried I'm going to have a baby. My daughter is due in a few months, and my son in law's due in a couple of months. What are you doing to try and get those kids' leases lined up as soon as possible?
I find it odd -- and annoying -- when people don't respond to or even acknowledge emails.	I don't respond to those, too busy lol

It would be great if there was a way we could all tell the best way to reach someone -- I know some people prefer texts to emails -- but if you're in a work situation, how do you ensure communication?	It would be so easy if everyone was on their phones it would be terrible. Maybe have people write down things like, "Hey, how are you doing today, if you could call someone or try to do something, what would you want to do?"
I recently had a big argument with my sister. We both got very upset and angry at each other.	I'm sorry to hear that. How did it turn out?
I'm not so sure. We just had a discussion that heated and became an argument with tempers flying.	You should talk to your boss and let him know what happened.
I felt most lonely when we first moved overseas, my husband then had to travel out of *that* country for business -- AND I had a new baby!	How did you cope?
From Santa Fe to Hong Kong -- ultimately a fantastic adventure. And I ended up with a wonderful group of friends. Expats bond quickly!	That sounds awesome. I bet you had a great time.

One of the saddest things to me is when people underestimate what they can do and/or are capable of.	Yes, I agree. I guess a lot of people think that they can do it all, or that they are the only one capable of something.

That's perfectly natural. You sound like the kind of person, though, that quickly regained their bearings. Disappointments like that usually come with some *good* lessons.	Exactly, I think a lot of people learn from their mistakes and move on.

Once my husband asked me not to tell my mom that he was busy that day when she needed his help but I told her anyway.  I really felt bad b/c he got pretty upset with me.	Were you able to tell him how you felt?

Yeah thats a good question.  I totally deserved him being mad.  I just felt bad for him b/c he was so busy that day and I didn't want him to have one more thing on his plate I guess	Sort of like when you have to get prepared for a new job or something new comes up... be like, "I guess I will try to be nicer next time"
There was a back neighbor that called my 10 year old son a ugly name one time, simply because he entered her yard slightly when he rode around the corner.!	I guess he wasn't very nice, hu?

Yes, she lived several house back and she didn't know me, until after she did that! She knew me then, but after I talked to her, she apologized to both of us.	That's good to hear, it's crazy how some people will know your name before you even know them!
Too often, it's a health scare that makes us value health. It inspires me to try and do something to keep healthy every day.	What are you considering acting on?

Happily, I don't have one! It's more seeing family and friends and the situations they're in. Not everything can be helped -- but there are some things we can all do to take care of ourselves, you know?	I hope you feel better!

Every time I look through older photos of my children, I'm taken right back to the time they were that size, and what we were doing! It's a bittersweet feeling, for sure.	Beautiful. It's in the genes.
Are your kids adults now?	Yep. They're in their 20s. What are you doing to pass the time?

I have an 18 year old as well -- I don't know about you, but it's hard to consider her an adult sometimes!	I have a hard time having confidence in myself but when I got married and I had my hair and makeup done I felt like I was beautiful!  I had so much confidence in myself that day and it was great!	It's so refreshing to find someone who feels the same way as you! It's a confidence booster!
I really try but it's hard to replicate that day for sure.	I'm sure it is! Did you at least make a bunch of copies?

My husband and I both work for ourselves -- a blessing and a curse at times, since it can be tough to determine a "regular" income.	We know what you mean. In times of stress my partner has decided he wants to work more hours and earn more money, and it irritates me.

We found a pretty good balance in that I have a part-time job that I *love* -- and that comes with benefits like insurance. That's a big worry addressed, right there.	Oh I *hate* to hear that! My parents *didn't* like me taking in welfare when I was younger. But now that I've made enough to be able to get a job, I feel *glad* that I've made the choice to work. The sacrifices I make *can* *be* made again if *needed*. I'm *relieved* to hear that
I am sorry, because I absolutely know that concern. I truly hope you find a resolution to that.	I met up with an old flame recently, didn't go how I expected	Oh, that's unfortunate. What happened?
Well, right after she gave me a big hug, she introduced me to her new boyfriend.	oh myww. that's cute. are you guys related?

I know right! No warning or anything. He turned out to be a nice guy, but I thought it was a little misleading on her part.	My family and I are going on vacation in a few weeks. We rented a largo beachfront condo and I can't wait!	You must be so excited about it. Will you be spending a lot of time in the sun?
We are going to be staying at Miramar Beach in Florida, about an  hour Panama City Beach. The view is amazing from our balcony and we are so ready!	That sounds awesome, Miramar is beautiful!

I was supposed to go for brunch with my friend Maria the other day. At least that was the plan.	Oh I am sorry to hear that. I hope things go well for you on the bright side is the plan. Just be patient and you will see!
Well, we had initially agreed to meet at 11. Wouldn't you know it, she didn't end up returning my text until 3PM!	Ugh I would be so upset, can you send her a message?
Me and my mom were at this grocery store recently and this guy started following us outside the store and then again inside the store it was so scary!	I hate that he would do that

Well I knew he was following us and so I asked the manager to walk us out to the car and when he did we saw the guy come out again from between the two buildings b/c he was waiting on us.  so scary!	Well I'm glad you managed to stay okay!
Did I tell you what happened with Li the other night? Boy do I feel dumb.	You should. Li is a goldfish. What happened?

She's 45 minutes late to our anniversary dinner. I don't know what happened to me but I called and left an angry message. Turns out, she had gotten T-boned at an intersection and was talking to the Police Officer when I called!	Oh no! That's such a horrible feeling. I'm sorry! Hopefully she pulls through and we meet at your place tonight!
Ugh! I looked like such a fool at my girlfriend's work party!	why what happened?

Well, I ended up having way too much to drink. One of her co-workers had a bottle of Fireball (gross I KNOW) and was making everybody do shots. I didn't want to look foolish, so I had... well too many.	Did you confront her about it?
Did I tell you what happened with the concert I was supposed to go to Saturday?	No. I just kind of shrugged it all off.
Well first of all, it wasn't just any concert - it was Jay-Z and Beyonce! AND IT GOT RAINED OUT!	Oh wow. I bet it was loud!
You are never going to guess who was sleeping on the couch when I got home from New York...	of course you were. who even knows haha
My friend Benny! The one we all thought died in a monsoon in Thailand!	oh my goodness, that's terrible. i loved him so much.

Recently, my husband came home from grocery shopping and had gifts for me for Mother's Day. He had a beautiful diamond ring and other lovely gifts, it was very unexpected!	I love diamonds, very exotic.
I did! I also gave him unexpected gifts and he was super happy. I was very touched by him being so thoughtful!	you are so thoughtful
I know I shouldn't count my chicks before they hatch, but I'm feeling pretty good after that interview today!	That's great! Chicks are so intuitive about reproducing.
This advertising company! The owner was there - you should have seen his face. My last freelance project was a real winner. Think I got it?	Think so! I think so too!
Did I ever tell you about the time I "got taken hostage"?	I do not remember.

As a heart attack. It was me and Big C at the World's Largest Pistachio. All of the sudden we hear gunshots, and DiDi's still in the car. We ran in the building, and he comes flying in after us. He never pointed the gun at us, and we ended up running away when he was distracted. It's too crazy - I can't make this up. Just glad to be alive!	Well at least you are okay, that is a good thing to know!

I went to visit a friend one day and her boyfriend made a pass at me. He actually suddenly kissed me, as I was waiting for my friend to return. I couldn't believe his nerve!	I'm glad you're okay! I hope you weren't hurt!

I quietly pushed him away, as I didn't want my friend to hear. I was so shocked and upset, since he knew I wouldn't want to make a scene and took advantage.	Wow, that's terrible of your friend. I'm sorry

This past Friday night our refrigerator stopped cooling! We had to go the weekend without it, and of course had to deal with some unpleasant smells and throw away a large amount of food! It wasn't a fun weekend for us!	Oh no! What did you do with all the food?

Yes, and of course we tried to call and have someone come out, but to no avail! You don't realize how much you rely on things like that until they aren't working!	of course i had that happen to me as well. my kids needed lots of things from both me and my husband but when they needed help the response was always the dealership. so when one doesn't work or isn't available we resort to the other!

I felt pretty bad when I was having girl talk with my friend and we were talking about our partners. Her boyfriend had made a pass at me, but I never told her about it.	Did she come out of it? I feel bad for you.

I felt bad, but she wasn't working and taking care of her grandchild, and her boyfriend was the financial support. I knew it would really be hard on her if she found out, not to mention she really loves him.	Well I hope at least she's found another job that a lot more guys seem to want, like a maid or someone else takes care of their kids instead

I was at the mall and hug my mom and said to her: Time to go Mommy! and i wasnt her, can you imagine my reaction to it?	oh my goodness, this is something that can only be described with amazement and astonishment! I truly feel your pain
Yes, totally but at the moment i felt like the stupidiest person on earth, didn't know were to hide! and my mom was watching	that is very nice of mom, she has taught you a lot

THe good thing about it, was the lady, she was laughing and later told me that it has happened to her childrens to, no worries!	I am looking forward to going on vacation in a few weeks! We have a condo reserved on the beach, with fantastic ocean views. I'm ready!	That sounds awesome! Where are you going?

Well, we are staying at Panama City Beach, so we're right there at the Gulf of Mexico.	I always love a beach that is cool and tropical, and the gulf is no exception! I hope you have a great time and are able to find the time to get to your destination.

I am definitely a proud parent of our 15 year old -- she was determined to work this summer, and even with us saying no one would hire her until 16 -- she found a job!	Oh wow. If she was determined like you I'm sure she will get a good one eventually. Good to hear that she worked hard for it.

That, and she's enjoying the independence of having her own money. Remember that? Making money that you truly could use for your *pleasure* (and not just necessities ?! ;-))	That's awesome. It sounds like she's making good decisions as well.

Same! I was surprised 15 year olds *can* actually work during the summer. It's just finding an employer who knows those hours get cut WAY back once school starts.	Okay, a silly pet peeve but one nonetheless -- when people just leave their grocery carts willy-nilly in the parking lot. No consideration for others or the people who work at the store!	Yeah, I've actually seen that happening a lot. Very annoying.

Me too. And I will always make sure to at *least* put it in one of those cart corrals, if not walk it back up to the store. Hey -- extra exercise ;-)	It's hard to not be around when you're not supposed to be. That's good.

WE CAN SAVE THE WOOOOOOORLD!!!!! (lol indeed....!)	I came home, and my wife showed me a picture in 4d of our future baby, my heart speeded so fast!	That is so cute. I bet it was scary thinking about it.
We choose to wait! but the amount of happiness in my body is tremendous! never felt this way before.	That is wonderful to hear

Yes, God willing the baby is going to be healthy in every way! can wait to ave the second	I love being in the "flow" -- whether it's in speaking to a group of people or working to help facilitate meetings.	That's so cool, I'm sure you are full of life vibes!

I work with different organizations on strengthening their culture, and I do large-scale visual notetaking (also known as graphic recording). Are you familiar with that at all? (Not unusual NOT to be!)	I have done both. I also do taping for some things. Are you a graphic designer?

That's one of the huge benefits -- learning about many different industries and subjects!	I LOVE when leaders know that it actually *helps* them to be surrounded by strong people -- people they can learn from, that challenge them, and that in some ways could be considered "better".	I could not agree more. I have worked in some of the largest and most prestigious companies in the world and never once have I found people necessary working with me that I trusted or challenged. It's so frustrating and puts EVERYTHING OFF!

It's just too many leaders want "yes men" and/or people who feel non-threatening. It's a trap and a quick path to mediocrity, if not failure!	It is difficult to stay committed for too long - even if you feel like you know your role and your role only has one type of person - and that type doesn't tend to change easily.

I'll always remember the day I learned I was pregnant with our first child -- Halloween in Chicago, and we were with friends at the Shedd Aquarium! I've loved baby belugas since ;-)	I did the same with Halloween. I loved the speed of the news cycle and the speed of the news cycle meant I loved any time the news cycle was moving in that direction. Such a beautiful moment to grasp and cherish.

Ha! True that ;-) That's also the year that A Bug's Life came out, and we always thought of our young one as "Dot", the spunky little girl ant in the movie.	Well, I never tire of watching movie reels, and it's always a classic. I'm sure it brought back a lot of good memories for you.
This mother's day was amazing! I got so much more than expected and it was all so heartfelt	I bet you got everything you wanted! What did you get?

Yes, definitely! I actually cried a few times because of how much thought went into each gift and what was written in the cards	I would have too if I was you. It's amazing how much thought and planning goes into a perfect Christmas dinner.
THat's too bad. What do you think went wrong?	The worst part was the baby crying. I'm so sorry.

Did they give you any feedback?	They didn't really comment on my game but they did question the way I play the game. I tried to give them feedback and they would typically give me criticism and negative feedback. It can be hard to differentiate the two though.
That is a shame, you need to learn from your mistakes.	Yep. There's nothing worse than throwing away those who love you.

I am nervous b/c so much rides on if this works or not.  If it doesn't than I have to take some really powerful meds that i would rather not take	i am sorry about that! All i can do is be myself and try to figure it out! i hope it works for you!

We just found out the person working in our accounting department has been stealing money from our company for years.	That's terrible, they should be in jail.

Yes, it just makes me sick to my stomach. You think you know someone but the whole time they are stealing you blind. I don't get some people	I don't know what you are talking about. I have known a few people who have had that happen and just had to move on.
I miss high school. My girlfriend was the best	I bet you were. I was in high school when I first met you. I wish I could go back to be with you.
That's great. College was also fun	Definitely, I had a blast doing it.
I recently bid farewell to a good friend. I miss her	How long has it been?
Thank you, that means a lot. I will see her again	When you meet again, always try to reciprocate
I lost my car keys. I'm such a fool!	That would be terrible. Did you find them?
That's pretty funny, and makes me feel better. This is the first time I've lost my keys so I hope to keep it that way!	I am sure it will be fine. The same goes for your wallet.

I came home the other day and my roommate had a friend over. I've only seen him with a friend over once in my 3.5 years of living here.	So your roommate is somewhat of a friend to him. And your best friend is a bit jealous of his friendship with yours. lol
Yeah I sure was, he seems to like this one much better than the last one he had over. He couldn't wait for that first guy to leave.	Yeah, you just have to go in and out as you please.

One of my co-worker came and asked me a lot of really weird questions about my supervisor. It seemed suspicious so I pretty much told her I didn't know any of the answers to her questions. I don't think she likes my supervisor.	oh thats awful, hameed you if you didnt cooperate
Yeah I figured it was, so I just played dumb and let my supervisor know. My supervisor has always been good to me.	That's good. Sometimes bad things happen when managers are lazy.
Man there aren't many people I would give my last couple hundred dollars to, with one notable exception.	Yeah, that's an unusual thing to say. What are you exception?

My buddy Stefan. He used it to print hundreds of bootleg concert posters. We sold them and netted $2000 a piece!	That's a lot of money! Well, it's good you got them for when you play your concerts again!
I finished first in a race. I feel like gold	A true silver lining to a bad year.
Yes! It was my first victory. All my hard work is paying off	That's great! I bet you are so proud.

Some of my friends told me that they had a big surprise for me. They know I hate surprises, but I complied and let the blindfold me and drive me out to the location.	Oh, so you trust them with your life information, etc. That is very trusting.
They had decided to pool their money together and get me one big present together. It was a flying lesson at the local airport.	Amen. No one can teach flying. You deserve the present you received.
I found an old photo album at my grandma's house that had pictures of me when I was a kid	oh thats wonderful.. it always makes me feel nostalgic
Yeah, it did. I really miss the 90s. Everything seemed a lot simpler in those days	do you still hang out with some of the same friends?

When I was in middle school, I had a friend come over to ride horses with me. After riding my mother pressured me to get on a horse bareback I wasn't comfortable riding. She made such a big scene that I got on to make her stop.	Oh my, did you ever give it a go?

Yes, the horse took off running and I got thrown into a metal fence. My mother then proceeded to yell and me and make fun of me for trusting her. She told me that I should never trust anyone not even my own parents, it was really embarrassing to get yelled at in from my friend. Afterwards my ribs hurt for 2 months.	I am sure it was embarrassing but I am very glad it ended well for you.

My friend really wanted me to go rollerblading with him, but I haven't been rollerblading since I was a little kid. I didn't want to roll into a car.	Oh you don't want to roll into a car then? That's awful, I hope you can find something else to do while you're away!

We went, but it was still pretty terrible because I felt completely uncomfortable and was bent over the whole time ready to catch myself.	Dang.. That sounds awful. I hope you was able to get some privacy to be fine.
My husband is on the road a lot, I hardley ever see him.	Oh, that hard. I bet your heart is racing. Is he alright?

Yes, its hard but I try to remember he does it for our family! I have been trying to adapt to enjoying alone time.	I suppose going it alone is never going to be enough. You need to let your partner know how you feel so that they can go from strength to strength in your relationship.
I have an interview for a job that I don't feel qualified for	I'm sorry you are feeling uncertain in the interview. Do you have a positive attitude about it?
I will try. I'm a pretty anxious person in general so it's hard	I am glad you have a positive attitude.
I'm moving in a few months to a new state, I'm starting to feel nervous.	I'm sure you'll be fine. It's been said that moving into a new place is a major life event.
To my husband hometown so it'll be new for me but he is excited to be back near family.	That's wonderful! Do you love your hometown?
I saw a dog get hit by car today on the highway.	poor dog, did he survive the impact?
It was pretty tramatic, I still see the dog getting hit in my head and the sound. No, I was on my way to work, I couldn't stop :(	That will be fun to watch, I am glad it is over for you!
I can't even begin to tell you how nervous I was about my first tattoo.	Why? What did you decide to do?
Definitely! I get lightheaded when I see my own blood, and my pain threshold was low at the time. It turned out great though, and now I have several!	What inspired you to get another?
I love my husband! He has been so sweet this week!	That's awesome to hear! There's nothing like a true love match- you'll always be thankful for that!
He knew I had a rough day today so he brought home my favourite wine and Taco Bell! It's the little things :)	Sounds like your dad is a great dad! lol
It's been a great week!	That's really great. What has been great?
I got a promotion at work that I wasn't expecting!	Congrats! What did you do?
Music is a powerful thing. Sometimes it feels like it can transport you to another time and place. You know what I mean?	It can transports me too! What kind of music do you like?

Who can deny it? My dad passed away 2 years ago. Sometimes I put on his old records and imagine what it would have been like to hang out with him in the 70s.	i can almost hear your heart racing am i dreaming it upright

I was feeling kind of down so I ended up snuggling with a stuffed rabbit I have. It brought back a lot of good old memories.	I love stuffed animals, I could never get my hands on a real rabbit. what fun!

Awe yeah thanks. He's pretty soft even though he some derpy eye that point in opposite directions. Brings me a lot of comfort and reminds me that someone cares.	A lot of people don't respond well to airsickness. I know I'm not.
My dog got hit by a car.	Oh god! Poor doggy! Hope you're hanging in there!
He did not live. I've never felt so sad before.	im sorry :( what happened?
Some random guy was in my backyard, I didn't realize before I looked outside that I was missing pants.	That is such a bummer!
Turns out he was the cable guy fixing a wire. Still mad he didn't ask permisson first.	Yeah I would've been pretty furious as well.
My family is still hasn't recovered from the untimely passing of my father two years ago.	Ohh good, what happened to him?

My siblings and I are managing, and have found some peace. My mother is a different story. It was just so sudden and unexpected.	I'm glad you've found time to grieve. I hope your mother has passed away peacefully.
I've got a week off from work. Time to sleep in and binge watch my favorite shows.	Video games is my escape!
I like It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia. I'm rewatching it for the third time	I haven't seen it in years. Maybe I should give it a try.
I was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity.	I'm glad you made it back home.

That is what I was thinking at the time, but I've been having a really tough time finding a job where I can advance into a higher position. I always seem to get positions with no mobility.	I am sorry to hear that. Maybe try your luck at an intern or temp agency?
I tripped on some steps in front of a whole bunch of people on my way to class.	Oh, I am sorry to hear that! That must have been embarrassing. Can it be replaced?
It was pretty humiliating. I fell flat on my face.	im sorry to hear that. you should get it patched up instantly
My boyfriend is sick. He can't eat much so I made some soup for him	oh its so hard to go through that long, i just know that he will get better, i wish you the best of luck, soup or alone
I made chicken noodle soup.	i love noodle soups it was so good
I had a meeting last week where I gave a presentation over the wrong documentation and no one said anything until after the meeting.	That's frustrating. Are you trying to get the blame?
After I figured out what I did, I sure was. Ate at my cube ever since I don't even want to make eye contact with anyone.	That's pretty neat. You're lucky.
I have a really big meeting next week. I have rehearsed what I am to go over all this past week and plan to practice a little more this weekend.	Do you feel confident?
It's a meeting presenting a new product to the board. Big stuff and big money for the company.	That sounds exciting. I hope you do well in front of the board.
I caught my boyfriend texting his ex	oh no! did you confront him about it?
It was definitely a bit flirty. I think he misses being with her	I know how you feel. The way a dog feels about his owner.

I know I broke up with my ex, but I can't help but feel irritated when he talks about going on dates.	I know it sucks when someone talks about going on dates, but it's good they let you make your own decisions! That's all we really are as a community. My ex would never do that!

We actually get along really well and are much better friends than a couple. I guess I still just get a littler territorial, i think he does too.	That's sounds great, I'm glad you have a good relationship with him.
I can't wait to see my final grades. I think I got all A's this semester.	Wow you sure did well. you must have studied really hard.
On Monday. I'm going to treat myself if I did well	I hope you did well. What are you most excited about?
I was very upset when I found my kitten today.	Oh no! Did it die?
No, I had to put it down. It ate a poisonous plant. He should not have been outside.	The owner of the dog knows what he's doing. I hope the owner takes responsibility for the dog.
I cried a bit, but kept it together for my little girl because she had let him out.	I enjoy visiting the nursing home on occasion.	That is kind of you. How long do you visit?
Not really, I take my daughter to see them, so many of them have no visitors at all.	Ah, I take mine too. They're always down to visit.
She likes to bake, so we take them what she makes :)	I will have to try one of her recipes. My kids are always asking for cookie dough adapted to the most diet perishable food.
She is pretty good for an eleven year old, better than I was.	She is pretty talented too. I am sure she will keep getting better.

I had a secret and went to my mother to confide in her, as well as get off my chest. I know she would never betray my secret and can always count on her.	That's good it worked out well dear, I hope you have many more years of happy memories to come!
Yes, I sure do! There aren't many people you can feel that way with and I am so grateful!	Good you should be feeling so grateful.
My son applied to a prestigious college and the wait killed us. I was anxious and nervous waiting to see if he was accepted!	I can imagine. Its great that you were patient.
He did! He's in his 3rd year, going to be an Aerospace Engineer, so we are very proud of him.	That's incredible! What is he going to be doing in Aerospace?

My sister passed away several years ago. She took her life, and my mother and I found her right after she did it. This was very painful, traumatic and hard for us all.	Sorry to hear that. I have lost both my parents, so I know the pain of a loved one going through something like that.

It didn't really seem to sink in for my mother for awhile, she was in denial. But, it was so hard when it did. I went into a depression for awhile, as she was my only sibling and we were very close.	I know how that feels, I lost both of my parents in one fell swoop. It doesn't happen often, but when it does, its not easy. I'm glad you're holding on.

When my son first started college, I felt so much love and affection, but it was definitely hard to see him go! I was very proud though.	I know that feeling for sure. It is hard to see people you love go, but it is even harder to support them.

He went to the University of Alabama in Huntsville. It's focused on science, engineering, etc. He's going to be an Aerospace Engineer. It's great to see him go for his dreams!	That's amazing, congratulations

We went on vacation a few weeks ago and went to the beach, It was so relaxing and great. I really enjoyed the time with my family.	That sounds so nice! You must have enjoyed being with your family. Do you like going on vacations?

That's great! I'm sure you earned it, just like we do. It's so good to get some time away from the hustle and bustle of life!	Yea, you're right. Now you have some alone time to recharge and recharge your brain. Sounds like it!
I am looking forward to next week! My husband has been out of town on business for several weeks and comes home next weekend!	What does he do?
I am going to cook a special meal and see if he wants to go out, just us two. I know he will like that.	That's great. You're a great mom and dad team!

My husband has been out of town a few weeks for work but is coming back next weekend. I have a surprise night planned for just us. I am optimistic and sure he will really enjoy it.	Do you love him not being away from you?
Thanks! We've been married almost 23 years but I try to keep things fun and spend time together.	Marriage is such a hard thing but so rewarding!

My son went back to college recently and it had me feeling a bit nostalgic. I could just picture him starting Kindergarten and it seemed not so long ago!	Oh I can just imagine that! I haven't been in 6 weeks! I feel the same way. I didn't go to college until I was 17!

Yes, very. But, time sure has flown by with him growing up. I can just see his little blonde head when he was 5 and just starting school!	He will have much older Sr. knowing what he went through. Not to mention the many memories little Michael will have with his father through his memories. Such as playing together, watching movies and games and more

I was promoted to a Team Leader and I felt very secure I could do well at the job. I had years of experience and was ready for a leadership role.	That's great! Congrats! I'm sure you'll be a great manager and lead your team to success!
Yes, thank you! I had worked very hard through the years, and I felt that I earned it, and would do well at it.	Very true. You should be proud of yourself.
There was an incident where one of my back neighbors called my young son a name and made fun of him. I was so mad, beyond angry!	What did you do?

Yes, and she had two children of her own, similar in age. Her son also weighed more than mine! She did it because my son rode his bike through the corner of her yard as rode around the circle, that made her mad! Can you believe that??	Ouch that's not something I would ever try to do! I can see how that can be frustrating though!
Last week my granddaughter started school for the first time. I worried about her the entire day.	I bet that was so exciting for her! But I am sure you were worried the whole week, too!
It turns out she loves and and I was a mess for 8 hours for nothing.	I'm sorry, I would've yelled at her.

I always try and plan everything in advance to bring everything we need when we go on vacation. We recently went on our honeymoon and I didn't do very well this time. Ugh!	It's okay if you're not good the first time. Everyone make mistakes! Take it as a lesson and keep your head up! Maybe next time!

I forgot everything. I guess I was so excited about the wedding, I totally failed at packing this time. Oh well, it was still fun.	At least the planning was fun. It's always good to get out and about.
One day I was visiting a friend and her boyfriend came up and kissed me, while I was waiting for my friend to return from another room! It was sneaky and repulsed me!	Wow! Did you tell your friend?

I didn't....only because of her situation. She had custody of her very ill and handicapped infant grandson, she wasn't working so depended on him financially and she was very much in love with him. She already suspected he was with other women, and stayed.....	Oh, thats sweet. I had one of those. She was my first girlfriend as a teen. Did you two ever cheat on it?
The other night I was home alone and all of a sudden I heard someone knocking at the door really loud and they wouldn't stop. I was so scared.	Did you get scared?
No, I ignored them and they finally went away. I was just about to call the police before they left though. I hope that doesn't happen again.	haha police is the last resort

I was trying to ignore the fact that my 50th birthday was coming up but my family decided to throw me a surprise party.	Well, that's really fun of them. You probably needed that as a reminder that you are old.

It was so much fun and such a happy night. I'm trying to embrace my age now and not ignore it any more	Oh you are aware that it can be a happy time? Sometimes we have happy phases where we aren't responsible for other people's happiness.

A few weeks ago, my husband and I had a big argument. I said some pretty hurtful things, and wished I hadn't. I felt very bad and disappointed in myself afterwards.	tomorrow is a better day than any other but remember that we are all human and have flaws
Yes, that's true. I tend to be a bit more verbal on my end and say things I regret later.	I probably should be nicer though, to at least be courteous.

One night when my kids and I came home, I saw a shadow in my hallway as I came in the back door. I was so scared and was afraid someone had broken in my home.	Ugh I would be scared as well, I'm sure you had your alarm on full blast.

Yes, and I live out in the country so I wouldn't get a quick response time from emergency vehicles. But, luckily, it turned out to be my shadow!	Yeah, I hope you weren't hurt! Shadowing someone is hard!

There was a day that I was a bit short on cash on hand and I didn't give money to a homeless man. I usually always do, as I feel it's my part to help those in need, as I am blessed. I felt very bad that I didn't that day.	Its hard to give in those times, I was scared you would have to sleep on the street
Well, homeless people aren't common in my area, so that's why I felt a bit bad about it.	Its ok, you arent alone
When my children were born, it was a rejoicing time for me. I can't think of a time I felt more happiness.	Aww, you must have a very happy wife and a happy life with them! That's sweet and wonderful.

Yes, I have two children and I feel so blessed to have them. I lucked out and got a boy and girl, both healthy, smart and wonderful.	That is really special. I am also expecting a boy, although we don't know for sure. We just know that he is going to be a wonderful addition to the family!

I used to work in a place where all my colleagues had different believes to myself. I wanted to stay true to what I believed in, so had to walk away from conversations on many occasions.	It must have felt very lonely. I am glad you are happy now.

Just that all people should be given an equal chance in life and that no one type of person is better than another, just because of their religion or skin color, or where they come from.	Yes, that is very true. There are some pretty good people on this planet though and I am one of them.

They believed that people of their religion where better than everyone else and were going to heaven, while the rest of us are left at the gate! That's one of their beliefs anyway. I don't agree with that, but chose to keep my mouth shut!	I recently bought a new car after not driving for several years and I was really scared to drive it, especially on the highway.	How come? Was it scary new?
Just a Honda Civic. People drive crazy around here. I don't want to have another car accident like the last one.	I see, I hope it isn't too bad!
I recently joined a group to help me lose weight. I have so much respect and admire everyone in that group so much.	Why did you join a group?
It has really helped to have their support. I am so grateful for them	It's wonderful to have their love!

A few years ago I applied for US citizenship. To succeed you have to pass a Civics test. I was so terribly nervous!	I never think about those things so my best guess is you just didn't study hard enough?
I passed! Turns out you only had to answer three questions correctly. But they have 50 to choose from so you have to study the lot!	It must have been a nerve-wracking moment. I'm glad you're fine!

Thank you. My poor husband had to sit every single night and test me. He's American and he didn't think he could pass!	I found some old Christmas cards the other day and had a lovely time reading them and reminiscing about the people who sent them.	Oh, what a lovely thing to do. What did you find?
It was so nice. I'm terrible about throwing cards out. I feel, if someone's taken the time to write, I should preserve it. Does that sound silly?	Must feel more precious

That's very true. My Dad kept everything too. When he passed we had quite a task sorting through things. I think my brother's still at it!	I am so happy for your loss. I lost my Grandma too when she was in her forties. I still remember the pains of her passing.
I believe you are right! My family are going to go nuts when they see what they've got to deal with, lol.	I would assume so since nothing like that has ever happened to me. That is great news.
When I was entering the store it was really slippery.	Hopefully you were not hurt
It had been raining , so I ran across the parking lot in to the store. I slid about 3 feet.	That falling objects are so annoying and hard to deal with.
I was fine, just felt like every one was looking at me.	I am feeling a bit guilty about keeping a secret for my friend.	Why is that?

I don't want to out her to her husband, usually the only thing that happens is they drop the friend.	Oh okay. I see. Well I hope it isn't too painful for her and that you both make friends again soon!

Thanks, I am just going to avoid them until it plays iteself out.	I feel kind of blue today, they announced the parts for the annual play.	Oh? That sounds like a lot of work! Do you feel any different than usual?
I did, and it is a good one, just not the one that I wanted. I didn't want the lead or anything.	Ah, that is funny. Lead's are easy to snatch back.
It is, my friend got it, or I wouldn't think about it so much. Thanks for the kind words though.	I'm teaching my daughter how to drive, and so far, so good!	So how does she do it? Does she drive?

She is!  At first, though, she was very nervous.  I told her we could start off slow - her dad lives 1 mile from me down a quiet road, so we started driving back and forth between the two houses.	That's a nice surprise! She sounds very lucky.

Hopefully by the first of the year.  We've worked up to driving to the dollar store 5 miles away.  She's still a little nervous but she's getting better and more confident the more we practice.	That's good that you are confident, she will be a lot braver.
I do what I can where I can.  Can't wait for our hard work to pay off and she gets her license!	That's awesome. I do the salsa when I'm not studying so I can get a scholarship in the future.
My house is a mess and I've got people coming over later on this evening.	Oh no, I'm sorry to hear that. What's been going on in there?

I'm going to try to.  If worst comes to worse, I'll just toss everything in my back bedroom, shiny up the floors and hope for the best!  *chuckle*	*chuckle* I guess that's a pretty good way to think about it, even if it's probably stressful.
My brother and I recently had to sell a house and he dealt with everything. I'm so lucky to have a brother I can rely on and who I know won't try and con me.	is it in a nice area?

We did and he was so precise with who got what and made sure he sent me my share quickly. He's such a neat brother in so many regards. I always know he'll be there for anyone who needs help.	You are most likely referring to your brother's share. In my family, it's quite common for the older brothers to be the breadwinners in the family and so the need for help is more important.

We weren't always close. When we were kids we were always fighting. It wasn't until we got older that we got closer. We're best of friends now.	That's really good that you can heal so easily. It's hard to find that kind of a relationship.

Don't be! There are many, many types of relationships and I don't think ours is necessarily typical. It's just the way it is :)	That's good that you don't copycats. I wish more people would be honest when it comes to relationships.

My son was in advance placement and honors during high school. He went to a prestigious college after, going for as an Aerospace Engineer. He never ceases to astonish me with his intelligence and admire me with how hard he works to pursue his dreams.	That's great. Aerospace is a pretty tough field.

I am quite proud, thank you! I also have a teenage daughter that is very smart and an amazing artist, (which I don't know where she gets that talent). They really impress me with amazing they are!	That is so great! That sounds like a lot of talent!
Going out today to learn a new route for my job and I'm hoping that I don't get lost.	Oh wow, I'm so sorry to hear that! I hope you're prepared!

I got the assignment yesterday, and I told myself that I'd go drive around it today and tomorrow.  My boss is supposed to ride along with me the first week, and then after that I'll be on my own.	Sounds like a great plan.

I was over here in the US when my Grandma passed in Scotland. I was so upset - nobody could get hold of me to tell me and her funeral was over before I knew about it.	Sorry about that. My condolences to your Grandma.
Only for funerals, unfortunately. Both my parents have since died. Unpleasant fact of life, I'm afraid.	I'm sorry you had to go through that. At least you have your parents to lean on.

Yes I was. I didn't come to the US until I was in my 30s. Didn't expect my Grandma to pass the minute I got here, but she was 96, so it shouldn't have been such a surprise!	Yup, I was shocked too...until I took all the state and took care of them
She was as fit as a flea too. She tripped and broke her hip and got a bad infection in the hospital. That's what she died of!	That's so unfortunate! I'm really sorry.
I just bought an Xbox! I've never owned a gaming console before	Awesome! What kind are you getting?
I am! I bought Halo and am ready to ride.	That's a lot of Halo. I've played a fair bit of other games too, but Halo has always been my favorite.

My father passed away 2 years ago, but my mother lives in my neighborhood now. I'm so thankful she lives close by and still here with us. She's such a wonderful mother.	Aww, that's sad. Do you have a mom to lean on now?

I'm sorry to hear that, I know it's so hard to lose a parent. I think we take them for granted when we are younger, but I am blessed she's still here.	I think its even harder when you are that young and don't understand the attachment more. Im sure you feel much better now that you hear this.
I am as happy as a clam right now. My neighbors are away for the weekend!	You are lucky! They are gonna have a party for the weekend. You can watch football or soccer or basketball or soccer lol
The live upstairs and constantly thump around, screeching into their cellphones. And then there's the video games...	It's a difficult situation. You wouldn't want to live in that house anyway.

Oh I am, believe me I am. The world seems like a calm, serene place where everything is just right!	My friend from across the continent came over yesterday! I was so happy about it	aww that is awesome! i have not come over in ages
We ended up hanging out and recording some audio. He is a voice actor	That's great, I love to listen to podcasts.

I was out for a walk one night in a suburb of Boston when we heard the cries of a young animal. It was a baby kitten, with no collar, in a window well.	That is so sweet and kind of you to help such a difficult situation.

We actually did, and ended up adopting him. He was still so young he needed formula, but now he is thriving!	That's amazing. Formula is the best when it comes to puppies. We just got a new Labrador Retriever, he's loving it so far too!
I felt a need to help when the baby bird was by itself	what did you do?
I did not, I was little but I think I put it back into a tree	That is so selfish of you.
Waiting to see if I would graduate was pretty unnerving	What made you waiting?
Yep, had to take a class online over the summer but it worked out	online or off?
I forgot my mother-in-law's birthday this year and can't look her in the eye!	Oh no! I'm so sorry. Do you feel embarassed?
I just feel so embarrassed - she never forgets my birthday. And my husband was away and didn't remind me :(	OH. I bet you felt bad. Did you ask her to forget it?

You're right. She's a very forgiving person and I've never forgotten before. It's on St. Paddy's day for heavens sake - how could I forget???	I was the only one wearing pajamas at this party, not my greatest moment	Oh lol. Well I am sure it was ok. Sometimes we wear pajamas to parties because we don't want to expose ourselves or because we don't want to wait for our turns.
I thought that it was a pajama party haha, never worn a dress before, maybe that's the secret	Yea! Have fun!
I had some trippy nightmares as a kid, now I don't really have dreams	That's pretty terrible. Is there any way you can talk to someone about it?
Yeah, it was like I was tied to a chair and a huge thing was staring at me, pretty weird	I would defenitly faint. I am just a little nervous.
I didn't realize that stealing was bad until I realized how it made me feel afterwards	Yeah. I had no idea. Poor kid deserves better.
No, I was scared to get charged, but I stopped after that	Ah, I see. I know that feeling now. How scary that could be!
I was at a meditation retreat last year for 10 days and I can say that I experienced a better feeling there than I could ever remembe	Thats so good, so peaceful and meditative.

Yeah, thankfully there's an app for that - Headspace (no I am not sponsored)	Ability to socialize and get to new clubs and events is something I have always wanted. I hope to get to like 20 clubs in 2 years.
I am really looking forward to going away for the holidays.	that is great. Are you going alone?
I want to go see the Harry Potter land at Universal, the kids will love it.	That sounds amazing! Harry Potter is my favorite author and I've always wanted to go to Japan.
They love the films, plus getting to ride Hogwarts Express, score!	I'm really hoping my acceptance letter shows up in the mail soon.	Oh I hope so too! I wish I could see it.
Law School, I'm pretty sure I got in to my first choice, but you never know.	I hope you did get in, that is a great accomplishment!
